SENT.plain: PURPOSE: We developed and evaluated a GM-CSF whole-cell tumor vaccine for esophageal cancer
EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN: Cell lines derived from surgically induced rat reflux esophageal tumors were passaged in vitro and transfected with GM-CSF
First, the GM-CSF whole cell vaccine was evaluated against subcutaneously transplanted esophageal tumor cells
In a subsequent study, the vaccine was tested to see if it could reduce the incidence of cancer in the surgical reflux model

RESULTS: While subcutaneously transplanted tumor cells produced lasting tumors in PBS non-vaccinated placebo rats, transplanted tumors regressed and were immunologically rejected in animals vaccinated prior to implantation
In the surgical reflux model, the vaccine reduced the incidence of cancer from 17/23 (74%) in the controls to 6/16 (38%) in the vaccinated animals (P = 0.046)

CONCLUSIONS: The GM-CSF whole cell tumor vaccine effectively promoted a strong immune response against subcutaneously transplanted tumors and protected animals from developing esophageal cancer in the reflux model
